availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisa, Kentucky, lawyer. New York native. Studied law with L.T. Moore in Louisa. Married to Rebecca A. Moore. Father of Henry M. Gallup and Frederick G. Gallup. Farmer in Venice, Cayuga County, New York in 1850. Entered law partnership with L.T. Moore in Louisa. Lawyer in Louisa in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Served in 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as regimental quarter-master from December 10, 1861 until May 11, 1862, when he was promoted to lieutenant colonel, then promoted to colonel January 13, 1863. Mustered out on January 31, 1865. Brevetted brigadier general on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Cayuga County, Venice.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 185.

William Ely, _The Big Sandy Valley: A History of the People and Country from the Earliest Settlement to the Present Time (Central Methodist, 1887) ,41.
